result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase M. Uebelher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Comply with conditions as stated in 16CF226 with the exception of the apology letters only ordered in 16CF226

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chase M. Uebelher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:14 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 15CT304, 16CF226, 16CF332, 16CF333, 16CF334, 16CF488, 16CM16, 16CM79

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

15CT304 Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST
16CF226 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST
16CM79 Counts 3 & 4 - NO CONTEST
16CF488 Count 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CT304 Counts 1 & 3, 16CF226 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5, 16CM79 Counts 3 & 4, .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed: 15CT304 Count 2
Dismissed and read-in: 
16CF226 Counts 1 & 6
16CM79 Counts 1 & 2
16CF488 Counts 1 thru 4, 6 & 7
16CF332 in its entirety
16CF333 in its entirety
16CF334 in its entirety
16CM16 in its entirety

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CT304 Count 1 - 
Serve 50 days jail
2 days credit
Huber granted
After 30 days, may be served on Home Monitor if jail administration allows. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Pay fine and costs totaling $1,744.00 
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
17 months revocation
17 months IID
Court signs the Order for Half-Priced IID
Cmplete DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan. 
Provide DNA sample. 

15CT304 Count 3 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs inclduign DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 

16CF226 Counts 2, 3, 4 & 5 - 
6 month jail, STAYED on each count concurent with each count but consecutive to any other sentence he may be serving. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Engage in any counseling deemed necessary or appropriate by his agent. 
Not possess any dangerous weapon or firearm. 
Write letters of apology to the victims Mr. Kaminsky, Ms. Hantke Jennifer and Raiven Breseman. To be provided to agent within the first 120 days of probation. 
Provide 1 DNA sample. 
Count 5 - Pay $100 fine plus costs including the DNA and Drug Abuse surcharges. 
Counts 2, 3 & 4 - Costs

16CM79 Counts 3 & 4 -
9 months jail on each count, STAYED concurrent with each other but consecutive to any sentence he might be serving. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Same conditions as ordered in 16CF226 with the exception of the apology letters only ordered on 16CF226. 

16CF488 Count 5 -
6 months jail, STAYED  
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Same conditions as ordered in 16CF226 with the exception of the apology letters only ordered on 16CF226. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Any cash bond posted is to be applied to the fine and costs.

records.addlTxt: Authorization to Appear - fax copy only
Pre-trial conference at 04-25-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Drengler files Authorization to Appear.   Makes statements to the Court. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Drengler enters NOT GUILTY pleas on the defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Atty Ryan Drengler appointed
Portage County Community Justice Program/Court Referral Form

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
No contact with Sara Goessl or her residence.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Criminal Damage-domestic and Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2,000 sig bond  with conditions as stated.
Atty McFarland requests sig bond.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
